title: Puppeteer Scraper Input
description: Use the following form to configure Puppeteer Scraper. The Start URLs and Page function are required and all other fields are optional. If you want to use Pseudo URLs, you also need to Use request queue. To learn more about the different options, click on their title or on the nearby question marks. For details about the Page function visit the actor's README in the ACTOR INFO tab.

useRequestQueue.title: Use request queue
useRequestQueue.description: Request queue enables recursive crawling and the use of Pseudo-URLs and Link selector.

pseudoUrls.title: Pseudo-URLs
pseudoUrls.description: Pseudo-URLs to match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine with Link selector to tell the scraper where to find links.

linkSelector.title: Link selector
linkSelector.description: CSS selector matching elements with 'href' attributes that should be enqueued. To enqueue urls from '<div class="my-class" href=...>' tags, you would enter 'div.my-class'.

pageFunction.title: Page function

proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Choose to use no proxy, Apify Proxy, or provide custom proxy URLs.

debugLog.title: Debug log
debugLog.description: Debug messages will be included in the log. Use context.log.debug('message') to log your own debug messages.

browserLog.title: Browser log
browserLog.description: Console messages from the Browser will be included in the log. This may result in the log being flooded by error messages, warnings and other messages of little value, especially with high concurrency.

downloadMedia.title: Download media
downloadMedia.description: Scraper will downloading media such as images, fonts, videos and sounds. This will slow down the scrape, but may help when certain websites are not loading correctly.

downloadCss.title: Download CSS
downloadCss.description: Scraper will download CSS stylesheets. This will slow down the scrape, but may help when certain websites are not loading correctly.

ignoreSslErrors.title: Ignore SSL errors
ignoreSslErrors.description: Scraper will ignore SSL certificate errors.

maxRequestRetries.title: Max request retries
maxRequestRetries.description: Maximum number of times the request for the page will be retried in case of an error. Setting it to 0 means that the request will be attempted once and will not be retried if it fails.

maxPagesPerCrawl.title: Max pages per run
maxPagesPerCrawl.description: Maximum number of pages that the scraper will open. 0 means unlimited.

maxResultsPerCrawl.title: Max result records
maxResultsPerCrawl.description: Maximum number of results that will be saved to dataset. The scraper will terminate afterwards. 0 means unlimited.

maxCrawlingDepth.title: Max crawling depth
maxCrawlingDepth.description: Defines how many links away from the StartURLs will the scraper descend. 0 means unlimited.

maxConcurrency.title: Max concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Defines how many pages can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. Use this option to set a hard limit.

pageLoadTimeoutSecs.title: Page load timeout
pageLoadTimeoutSecs.description: Maximum time the scraper will allow a web page to load in seconds.

pageFunctionTimeoutSecs.title: Page function timeout
pageFunctionTimeoutSecs.description: Maximum time the scraper will wait for the page function to execute in seconds.

customData.title: Custom data
customData.description: This object will be available on pageFunction's context as customData.

initialCookies.title: Initial cookies
initialCookies.description: The provided cookies will be pre-set to all pages the scraper opens.

preGotoFunction.title: Pre goto function
preGotoFunction.description: This function is executed before navigation to a given URL. It can be useful to do pre-processing, changes to the page that allow bypassing anti-scraping protections or just setting cookies.
